programme.title: Picture Locked
programme.sub-title: Picture Locked: Chris Temple & Zach Ingrasci
programme.desc: Filmmakers Chris Temple and Zach Ingrasci break down their work, including "Five Years North." Directed by Yasir Masood & Victor Kamwendo.

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Little Big
programme.desc: DOCUMENTARY+ invited Ilya Prusikin to share their personal story. Ilya is a musician, songwriter, and lead vocalist of the Russian pop-rave superband, Little Big. Ilya recounts the on the ground events of February 24th, the day Russia invaded Ukraine, the group's journey to seek political asylum in the United States, and navigating being labeled a traitor by the Russian government for being outspoken against the war. Directed by Yasir Masood.

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Rannel Ngumuya
programme.desc: DOCUMENTARY+ invited Rannel Ngumuya to share a personal story. Rannel Ngumuya is a graphic designer, artist, NFT entrepreneur, and founder of breakout band Bungalo Boy, whose artistic endeavors helped him break through barriers as a first generation immigrant and DACA recipient. Directed by Victor Kamwendo & Yasir Masood.

programme.title: Bloody Nose, Empty Pockets
programme.desc: On the eve of the 2016 U.S. presidential election, and on its final night before closing, a Las Vegas dive bar becomes a stage where its employees and barflies commiserate one last time. Directed by filmmaking brothers Bill and Turner Ross.

programme.title: Blood, Sweat and Beer
programme.desc: Blood, Sweat, and Beer follows a trio of 23-year-olds as they struggle to start The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co. in Braddock, PA., a once-prosperous steel town hoping to bounce back from decades of neglect, violence, and population loss. The film also follows Danny Robinson, a boardwalk brewery owner whose business is threatened by an aggressive trademark lawsuit that could leave him bankrupt. Directed by Chip Hiden and Alexis Irvin.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 1
programme.desc: Gordon arrives at the notorious HM Prison Brixton, in the hopes of taking non working prisoners and molding them into working cooks. Can Ramsay deal with offenders from murders to a man who was found with a shotgun under his bed?

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 2
programme.desc: As Gordon's business gets busier, the prison's stringent systems and routines start getting to him, and he struggles to keep his brigade together. Serial offender Lawrence loses it in the kitchen and tries to attack another prisoner, and the authorities stop Jerome from being able to bake.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 3
programme.desc: After two months of success, Gordon now wants to expand the prisoner's food selections and go commercial. Meanwhile the team has dwindled down yet again.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 4
programme.desc: The six months are up, the team is now even smaller, and everything is now on the line. Can it all be a success? Can lives be turned around? Will the program be allowed to continued?

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen B
programme.desc: One of the most recognizable figures in contemporary music. Get lost in the ultimate story of modern day superstardom as we take you through the incredible journey of Beyonc√©. Directed by Billy Simpson.

programme.title: Life In Miniature
programme.desc: Kath Holden is an artist of the everyday. Inspired by the world around her, Kath's creations are whimsical yet keenly observed, and a far cry from the genteel museum pieces that her contemporaries are producing. A proud Yorkshire woman, Kath reflects on her life and art as she carves a place for herself in the precious world of miniatures. Directed by Ellen Evans.

programme.title: Adele: Homecoming
programme.desc: Adele is a Grammy Award-winning artist whose soulful sound has thrust her into the limelight. Her soulful voice, frank personality and chart-topping hits have made her one of the most successful artists of all time. Her authenticity in her work appeals to so many; there are no gimmicks with Adele. What you see is what you get. Through her own words, video and live performances, this documentary takes an incredible look at the life and times of one of the greatest artists of all time. Directed by Billy Simpson.

programme.title: Selena Gomez: Devotion
programme.desc: After returning from her five year break from music, Selena Gomez has blown the world away with her third studio album Rare. She has transformed over the years, from Disney pop star to award winning film and tv producer. She is one of the biggest stars in Hollywood and is certain one of the most devoted to her art. This is the life and career of Selena Gomez. Directed by Matt Salmon.

programme.title: Elton John: A Life In Song
programme.desc: Elton John's career has spanned decades, but his legacy is more than just his music. Reginald Dwight's early debut was in the band Bluesology - there he would meet lyricist Bernie Taupin whom he would go on to write over 30 albums with. After parting ways with the band and his birth name, the Rocketman was born. Directed by Finlay Bald.

programme.title: Forensics: Operation Edgewater
programme.desc: At 1.20am on a dark rainy Sunday morning the residents of a suburban street are woken by the sounds of a taxi crashing into a brick fence. There was no squealing of brakes. A witness rushes to help and finds the driver slumped over the steering wheel. He is bleeding profusely from wounds in his neck and chest, his foot is still pressing the accelerator, the engine still running.

programme.title: Forensics: Operation Nadia
programme.desc: At 7.30am on a mild, summer morning, a middle-aged woman goes into her backyard to unlock the self-contained unit where her 23-year-old daughter lives alone. She lets her daughter‚Äôs dog out and notices a pair of overalls lying on the floor, half-in, half-out of the bedroom. The overalls should be with her daughter who, by now, would normally be on her way to work at a recycling facility. The woman takes a closer look and finds her daughter‚Äôs body lying face-down on the bedroom floor, cold. She calls out to her husband, they phone emergency services and the operator tells them to roll over their daughter - her throat has - been cut.

programme.title: Forensics: Operation Keppel
programme.desc: An abandoned car is discovered in a quiet Hamilton street. Police are called and they find an envelope with money in it, an IOU note and a suitcase with women‚Äôs clothing in it. They trace the car‚Äôs owner as a young mother, Carmen Thomas, who lives in Auckland and hasn‚Äôt been seen for several days. Her ex-partner, Brad Callaghan, says that she missed a scheduled pick up of their young son and that he is concerned for her well-being.

programme.title: Forensics: Operation Drake
programme.desc: Two males visit a New Plymouth house in the middle of the night, staying only a few hours before they leave. The following day the occupants discover what they think is a body left in the garage. Police are called.

programme.title: The Hunt For Gaddafi's Billions: Episode 1
programme.desc: Inside the relentless hunt for the late Libyan leader Colonel Muammar Gaddafi's money. On the trail of bounty hunters, corrupt politicians and spies. A story of greed, corruption and deceit, up to the highest circles.

programme.title: The Hunt For Gaddafi's Billions: Episode 2
programme.desc: Inside the relentless hunt for the late Libyan leader Colonel Muammar Gaddafi's money. On the trail of bounty hunters, corrupt politicians and spies. A story of greed, corruption and deceit, up to the highest circles.

programme.title: Murderers and Their Mothers: Hamilton
programme.desc: Thomas Hamilton committed Britain‚Äôs deadliest mass shooting when he entered Dunblane Primary School in March 1996 and took the lives of 16 children and their teacher, before turning the gun on himself. Growing up with a hidden family secret and an unhealthy relationship - with his mother, his resentment against the world culminated in an unimaginable, heinous act of evil.

programme.title: Murderers and Their Mothers: Peter Sutcliffe: The Yorkshire Ripper
programme.desc: In this episode, serial killer Peter Sutcliffe terrorized the North of England for six years in the 1970s. Nicknamed ‚ÄòThe Yorkshire Ripper‚Äô, he brutally murdered at least 15 women and left many more - seriously injured. Growing up a mummy‚Äôs boy, Sutcliffe would later develop a warped view of women and a morbid fascination with the macabre, and would go on to become one of most notorious murderers in British history.

programme.title: Murderers and Their Mothers: Moore
programme.desc: Peter Moore terrorized a community in North Wales for decades, brutally assaulting men in the dead of night under the cover of darkness, all the while living with his doting mother. She - was the centre of his Universe as he was hers, and when she died he embarked on a four-month killing spree, murdering four men in 1995 purely for his own sexual gratification. Moore had been - known as a local hero who, the saviour of the local cinema, nobody suspected Moore, and it was only until his arrest that the truly evil acts of this serial killer were exposed.

programme.title: Murderers and Their Mothers: Howe
programme.desc: In this episode, 21-year-old Mark Howe developed a deadly obsession with knives, serial killers and violence, and retreated into a virtual world where he shared his unexplainable hatred for his mother with online friends. Once the apple of his mother‚Äôs eye, she tried in vain to intervene as her son transformed into a hateful monster. One who would ultimately take her life in a frenzied, violent stabbing, leaving her to bleed to death on her bedroom floor.

programme.title: Murderers and Their Mothers: Michael Ryan: The Hungerford Massacre
programme.desc: In this episode, in 1987, Michael Ryan committed Britain‚Äôs deadliest massacre of its time, shooting 16 people and injuring 16 more. Doted on by his mother, Ryan grew up to be a spoilt loner who was - obsessed with weapons and the military, creating his own fantasy world in which he modeled himself as a courageous and dangerous action hero. Ryan would go on to carry out a deadly mission of his own making, when he murdered 16 people, including his mother, in cold blood, before finally turning the gun on himself.

programme.title: Call The Cops: Juggling Chainsaws
programme.desc: It's the Easter Bank holiday in Devon and Cornwall, when the force‚Äôs Control Rooms must deal with over a thousand incidents a day with a overstretched crew of frontline officers.

programme.title: Call The Cops: Breaking Point
programme.desc: "This is the worst time I have ever known‚Ä¶if we had more police, they wouldn‚Äôt be able to get away with it so easily,‚Äù says convenience store owner Colleen,¬†after being robbed for the fifth time in a - little over a year.
